column2: MO DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.
column8: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 2. When you see this sign you should:
column4: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column6: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column8: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column10: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.

column2: 3. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column6: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.
column8: they already are within the intersection.
column10: there are no pedestrians crossing.

column2: 4. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column6: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column8: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column10: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.

column2: 5. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column6: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column8: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column10: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column8: Lane shifting
column10: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column8: Mountain trail
column10: Flagger ahead

column2: 8. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column6: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column10: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.

column2: 9. Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
column8: early enough so other drivers know your intention.
column10: after changing lanes.

column2: 10. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column8: brake suddenly.
column10: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column8: Wrong Way
column10: Steep grade ahead

column2: 12. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column6: honk to let them know you’re there.
column8: speed up to pass.
column10: move to the left lane.

column2: 13. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column6: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column8: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 14. What does this sign indicate?
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column10: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 15. These are:
column8: route signs.
column10: speed limit signs.

column2: 16. This road sign is:
column8: a speed reduction sign.
column10: a warning sign.

column2: 17. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: come to a complete stop.
column10: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 18. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column8: black and orange.
column10: brown and white.

column2: 19. Bicyclists must:
column4: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column6: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column8: remain near the left edge of the road.
column10: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.

column2: 20. When the road is slippery, you should:
column6: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.
column8: pump your brakes.
column10: use your emergency or parking brake.

column2: 21. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column8: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.
column10: use your brake lights.

column2: 22. When are you allowed to pass another vehicle by using the shoulder of the road?
column4: When the traffic ahead is blocked up for 250 feet.
column6: When the vehicle in front of you is making a left turn.
column8: Never.
column10: To go around a slow moving vehicle.

column2: 23. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column8: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column10: Look to the left and right for other traffic.

column2: 24. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: The use of headlight is required by law.
column8: Driving within the range.
column10: Reduced speed.

column2: 25. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column6: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column8: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column10: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
